oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Citizens to Preserve Overton Park Album
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Citizens to Preserve Overton Park; Overton Park; parks; I-40; Lick Creek; Memphis Zoo; trees; Memphis College of Art; Girl Scouts;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph album "showing the character of Overton Park" that was submitted by the Citizens to Preserve Overton Park at the 1972 I-40 public hearing conducted by the Tennessee Department of Transportation. Comprised of photographs and pages from Architecture Memphis magazine. Includes a memo and a letter from Anona Stoner detailing the purpose of the album. Also includes transfer documents, as it was loaned to US Secretary of Transportation Brock Adams in 1977. Originally a bound album, it has been separated into 16 separate leaves, some 2-sided.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Stoner, Anona
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Citizens to Preserve Overton Park, Inc.
